javadoc: Configuration of a tool that knows how to create tools.

methods.javadoc:
Get the name for the tool.
@return the name
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Get the name for the tool.

methods.name: getPath
methods.comment:
Returns the path from whence this tool template came; may be null if the tool was not 
 loaded from the filesystem

methods.javadoc:
Set the name for the tool template.
@param name new tool template name
methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Set the name for the tool template.

methods.javadoc: Get the iconURL for this tool template.
methods.name: getIconURL
methods.comment: Get the iconURL for this tool template.

methods.name: getIcon
methods.comment:
Get the icon for this tool template.  This is equivalent to calling
 getIconURL().getIcon()

return.comment: the icon for this tool template.

methods.name: getSupportedDataTypes
methods.comment:
Get the classes of the data types that this tool supports,
 i.e., what data types can be dropped onto this tool.

return.comment: list of supported data type classes.

methods.javadoc:
Save this object to an XML Element.
@return the ToolConfig saved as an XML element
methods.name: saveToXml
methods.comment: Save this object to an XML Element.

return.comment: the ToolConfig saved as an XML element

methods.javadoc:
Restore this object from a saved XML element.
@param root element to restore this object into
methods.name: restoreFromXml
methods.comment: Restore this object from a saved XML element.

params.name: root
params.comment: element to restore this object into

methods.name: createTool
methods.comment: Creates a tool like only this template knows how.

params.name: project
params.comment: the project in which the tool will be living.

return.comment: a new tool for this template implementation.

methods.javadoc:
This returns the XML element that represents the tool part of the overall XML hierarchy.
@return the XML element that represents the tool part of the overall XML hierarchy.
methods.name: getToolElement
methods.comment: This returns the XML element that represents the tool part of the overall XML hierarchy.

return.comment: the XML element that represents the tool part of the overall XML hierarchy.

name: ToolTemplate
comment: Configuration of a tool that knows how to create tools.
